trans-unit.source: Represents a display device or multiple display devices on a single system.
The constructor for this object is not public, so you cannot explicitly create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Screen> object.
The object is created when you call its public methods.
Gets an array of all displays on the system.
An array of type <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref>, containing all displays on the system.
Gets the number of bits of memory, associated with one pixel of data.
Typically, the number of bits per pixel for a screen is useful when working with bitmaps.
For more information about bitmaps, see [Types of Bitmaps](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/types-of-bitmaps.md).
The number of bits of memory, associated with one pixel of data
Gets the bounds of the display.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>, representing the bounds of the display.
Gets the device name associated with a display.
This string may contain non-printable characters.
The device name associated with a display.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the specified object is equal to this `Screen`.
The object to compare to this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref>.
`true` if the specified object is equal to this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Retrieves a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref> for the display that contains the largest portion of the specified control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> for which to retrieve a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref> for the display that contains the largest region of the specified control.
In multiple display environments where no display contains the control, the display closest to the specified control is returned.
Retrieves a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref> for the display that contains the largest portion of the object referred to by the specified handle.
The window handle for which to retrieve the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref> for the display that contains the largest region of the object.
In multiple display environments where no display contains any portion of the specified window, the display closest to the object is returned.
Retrieves a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref> for the display that contains the specified point.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that specifies the location for which to retrieve a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref> for the display that contains the point.
In multiple display environments where no display contains the point, the display closest to the specified point is returned.
Retrieves a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref> for the display that contains the largest portion of the rectangle.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the area for which to retrieve the display.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Screen"></xref> for the display that contains the largest region of the specified rectangle.
In multiple display environments where no display contains the rectangle, the display closest to the rectangle is returned.
Retrieves the bounds of the display that contains the largest portion of the specified control.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> for which to retrieve the display bounds.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the display that contains the specified control.
In multiple display environments where no display contains the specified control, the display closest to the control is returned.
Retrieves the bounds of the display that contains the specified point.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that specifies the coordinates for which to retrieve the display bounds.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the display that contains the specified point.
In multiple display environments where no display contains the specified point, the display closest to the point is returned.
Retrieves the bounds of the display that contains the largest portion of the specified rectangle.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the area for which to retrieve the display bounds.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the display that contains the specified rectangle.
In multiple display environments where no monitor contains the specified rectangle, the monitor closest to the rectangle is returned.
Computes and retrieves a hash code for an object.
This method implements the <xref:System.Object> method.
A hash code for an object.
Retrieves the working area closest to the specified point.
The working area is the desktop area of the display, excluding taskbars, docked windows, and docked tool bars.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that specifies the coordinates for which to retrieve the working area.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the working area.
In multiple display environments where no display contains the specified point, the display closest to the point is returned.
Retrieves the working area for the display that contains the largest portion of the specified rectangle.
The working area is the desktop area of the display, excluding taskbars, docked windows, and docked tool bars.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the area for which to retrieve the working area.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the working area.
In multiple display environments where no display contains the specified rectangle, the display closest to the rectangle is returned.
Retrieves the working area for the display that contains the largest region of the specified control.
The working area is the desktop area of the display, excluding taskbars, docked windows, and docked tool bars.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> for which to retrieve the working area.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the working area.
In multiple display environments where no display contains the specified control, the display closest to the control is returned.
Gets a value indicating whether a particular display is the primary device.
`true` if this display is primary; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the primary display.
For a single display system, the primary display is the only display.
The primary display.
Retrieves a string representing this object.
A string representation of the object.
Gets the working area of the display.
The working area is the desktop area of the display, excluding taskbars, docked windows, and docked tool bars.
The working area is the desktop area of the display, excluding taskbars, docked windows, and docked tool bars.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Screen.WorkingArea%2A> will return the entire area of the screen if the Windows Taskbar is set to Auto-Hide, no matter whether the Taskbar is currently displayed or not.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>, representing the working area of the display.
